\lae\c[18]He\c[0] told me that his friend would go
along with him. His friend wearing robes
and a constant smile on his face. A
smile that guards his inner hurt.

and quick to doubt others, but quick to
\lae\c[18]He\c[0] told me that another one would tag
along. Another one wearing leathers and
unsure of her place on the team. One that
has many questions of her past on her mind.
\lae\c[18]He\c[0] told me that it would be my job to
make sure that they never reach Telluria.
\laeThis forest is the final resting place of
a knight and a cleric. I don't remember which
ones, but I still remember killing them.
They weren't any different than the others.
the land has shifted. I'm certain that the
Overworld looked much different as hundreds
of thousands of years have gone by.
have been where Telluria Castle stood

would have won that battle. Maybe

\laeNo matter how close we get to wiping
out the human race, you always bounce
back. It's not truly a victory until
every last human has been killed.
\laeAnd that would be for the best.
a feeling that \c[18]Apocalypse\c[0] won't be happy to

\p2Whatever the reason, it was still creepy.

How can you not be worried about this?

\samI trust that you four can make the

GabText The team walked back through the forest.
GabText Their mission completed, they remained in silence.
GabText The day was still ripe.
GabText They prepared for the celebration that they'd be greeted with.
Years... centuries... no, millenia of harsh
conditions have eaten away at this grave.
Anything that might have resembled words is long gone.
